## SYNOPSIS

Configure certificate authorities for certificate-based authentication

## SYNTAX

### Certificate

```powershell
Set-MsIdCbaCertificateAuthority [-Certificate] <X509Certificate2[]> [-CertificateRevocationListUrl <String>]
 [-IsRootAuthority] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
```

### InputObject

```powershell
Set-MsIdCbaCertificateAuthority [-InputObject] <Object> [-CertificateRevocationListUrl <String>]
 [-IsRootAuthority] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
```

## DESCRIPTION

\{\{ Fill in the Description \}\}

## EXAMPLES

### EXAMPLE 1

```powershell
$CertificateAuthorities = @'
[
{
    "Subject":  "CN=DoD Root CA 3, OU=PKI, OU=DoD, O=U.S. Government, C=US",
    "certificate":  "",
    "isRootAuthority":  true,
    "certificateRevocationListUrl":  "http://crl.disa.mil/crl/DODROOTCA3.crl"
},
{
    "Subject":  "CN=DoD Root CA 4, OU=PKI, OU=DoD, O=U.S. Government, C=US",
    "certificate":  "",
    "isRootAuthority":  true,
    "certificateRevocationListUrl":  "http://crl.disa.mil/crl/DODROOTCA4.crl"
}
]
'@
PS > Set-MsIdCbaCertificateAuthority $CertificateAuthorities
```

Configure certificate authorities for certificate-based authentication

## PARAMETERS

### -Certificate

Root and intermediate certificates

```yaml
Type: X509Certificate2[]
Parameter Sets: Certificate
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False
```

Type: Object

Accept wildcard characters: False
